title: What are some of the most important marketing philosophies? - Quora

response.answer_text: This query intrigued me, yet I am naïve about this, so I did some ‘surfing’. I ‘plagiarized’ these findings. Aimen Sheikh: Software Engineer from Pakistan There are marketing distinctions: Product Use and Design, Production, Advertising, Sales. A company should choose, or create, the proper process according to the anticipated customers’ desires, needs, expectations. Naveen Sivakumaran: Marketer & Writer based in Sydney, Australia Marketing philosophy is all about creating ‘consumer’ awareness and building ‘brand’ awareness. Marketing encompasses the following elements: Product, Place, Price Promotion, People, Process & Physical Evidence, all of which are crucial to taking the product/service to the end-customer. There are two distinctions to consider: ‘Original’ sales, and ‘Repeat’ sales. There needs to maintain a certain integrity within these phases in order to generate customer satisfaction and sustainability over a wide range of fluid cultural biases and expectations.

Hi there, Hmmm very interesting question. If you mean marketing philosophies that turn a prospect into sales then I would say these are it: A deep understanding of your client’s pain“Speak” to their pain via your unique messageCombine the highest converting events on the web right now (funnels + webinars).Always be testing.Once your message is dialed-in, automate your market and begin scaling.Looking forward to your feedback. Thanks, Tariq
